title: Small Business Case Study
description: Small Businesses can be a great source of organic growth, few see value in blockchain, nor understand how it can solve fundamental problems.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal appears to have been a better fit for the DApps & Integration challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
"Former Java developer" and being a self-identified SPO w/o any proof is not nearly enough to build confidence. Since there are still many open questions and a big part of this proposal is research, this proposal may be resubmitted (if not funded) in the Fund 7 Research Challenge (if that gets funds allocated to).

An observation that I want to share is also that I found it somewhat odd to read that part of the funds are allocated for a dedicated machine for development. I expected a proposer who would be the implementer of the proposal already having a working machine for development. I hope this observation did not make it into my rating for this part of the assessment, but I must wonder if other CAs or voters might find this odd.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPIs make sense (with the caveat that this proposal may not be in the right challenge in the first place) and are understandable. The community should be able to track the progress as outlined in the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is not very clear and it fails to show how it will attract future proposers. Just by issuing a case study on one company, it does not mean that new proposes will be onboarded. The company which is to partner with the proposer has not yet been identified. Most of the money requested will go towards preparing an employee incentive program for a specific company. This has nothing to do with proposer outreach. The proposer expects to publish case study after 1 year, this is very difficult and any results based on the past few months of product launch will not be an accurate gauge of the results achieved. Finally, it is unclear how the project if successful is to be advertised and would finally results in more proposers.
f6_assessments.q1: A former java developer is proposing to create a decentralised employee incentive program for an undisclosed company and later sharing the benefits of such program. Considering all the unknowns it is very unclear whether the project will be implemented successfully. More so, the proposer speaks of 'problems best tackled with Cardano' but fails to identify any.
f6_assessments.q2: The project does not have any KPIs and is very vague. The only things that can be tracked is the supposed creation of an initial code which should solve unidentified problems and later a Case Study without predefined metrics and goals. Since goals and success metrics are not clearly defined, then these cannot be tracked.

f6_assessments.q0:
Has the problem needing to be solved been identified and articulated?

The problem has been defined as that small businesses dont see value in blockchain. This to  seems somewhat vague as it is a very broad statement

Does this proposal fall within the scope of the challenge brief?
This does not fall within this particular challenge brief. This would be more suitable for the DApps and Integrations section

Does this proposal show clearly how it will add value to the Cardano System?
Its capability of adding value is somewhat limited, as it may not solve a specific problem. It seems to be a Research and Development project with the hopes of a finished product at the end of it.

Have key metrics and goals of the proposal been stated clearly 
No

Do the key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge
None defined.


Can the proposal scale to address future challenges?
No

This is a basic proposal which is somewhat vague. It is a research project which is suited to the Dapps and Integrations section.  
I dont think this proposal meets the standard required for funding nor does it meet the Impact criteria.
f6_assessments.q1:
2. FEASIBILITY

Has the proposer provided evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal?
No links, CV, Linkedin profile are given

Are these links sufficient?
No

Have you the CA visited these links and contacted the relevant people?
No links given

Have you been able to assess their level of competence?
Impossible to assess

Does proposer know, in an identifiable manner, the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal?
He is working alone

Has he rationally and logically laid out his team structure and breakdown?
THere is no team structure

Has budget been outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items?
Budget is very high. Includes Hardware purchasing, as well as a full time job role for a years period.

IS budget reasonable to achieve the set goals?
This is difficult for me to justify.


Has the proposer provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required to implement the proposal?
There is no verifiable plan if additional funds are needed

Have you verified this plan?
No

Does proposal offer a realistic timetable to complete the work?
There is no way to assess if the timetable is realistic

Does the proposal provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how?
The proposal shows at a high level what is to be done, but does not go into specifics since this involves a learning time as well.

Does the plan describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal?
The resources needed are described

Does the proposal clearly explain  technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies if they are crucial for implementation?
This has not gone into technical aspects

Has the proposer considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation?
No risks or challenges have been considered.
f6_assessments.q2:
3) Auditability

Is there clearly laid out a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement.
There is a roadmap laid out but this includes a 3 month phase for learning what problems can be solved by Cardano.

Are there clearly defined Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal?
There are no clearly defined metrics.

Is there a clear understandable description of the targeted problem?
The targeted problem has not been identified, and is said to be found within 3 months 

Is there a clear understandable solution that addresses the problem?
The problem has not been identified

Has the proposer identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties?
No

How does the proposer plan to deal with these difficulties?
Not defined

Are there contingency plans in place for various outcomes?
No

f6_assessments.q0: if the proposal would be successful, in the end, it would provide a guideline on how to proceed, yet the motivation of new people would remain untouched.  The number of proposers would increase after one year (according the the time frame), and still, it would be most likely not so effective as it is aimed, in this fund section.
